history.text: You should see "Home Alone."
I like the second half, but it starts pretty slow
Do you think the rating is fair?
I agree. The first have is flat and unsurprising as it its cute little premise suggests.
Yes. John Hughes is great, but I can see how adults would get tired of the booby-traps and adult bashing.
It's pretty unrealistic, considering how much the booby traps would cost to construct
The slapstick humor can get old so the emotional parts help hold the movie together.
I agree, the ending especially
The conversation between Kevin and Marley?
That too
What did you think of the events leading up to Kevin being left behind?
It made you feel bad for Kevin as his siblings, cousins, aunts and uncles, and even his parents seemed to gain up on him. Getting sent to the attic is pretty harsh.
I agree, but I think that Kevin "wishing that his family would disappear" in a movie about him being left alone was a little predictable
I don't see how an eight year old would believe that he made his family disappear because of the wish.
That's not what I mean. I mean that it's a little flat and maybe even boring writing
I see. The confusion and rush to the airport was pretty unbelievable but well done in the movie. So you think maybe it could happen?
Maybe, yeah. I think that Kate's journey to get back to Chicago were also a little... convenient
A convenient plot device. Certainly not the greatest thing to be in a van with a traveling polka band from Scranton to Chicago.
Ha, that's true. I don't think there was any deeper meaning to that sub-plot though, and that's where the issue lies with the first half of the movie
I doubt absolutely no flights would be available nowadays.
And no rental cars either?
Of course not. The plot has contrivances to set up Kevin being left home, alone
The movie was ready to take a really dark turn when Harry and Marv finally captured Kevin.
It's a nice relief when Marley hits them with his shovel
The police were pretty useless. They got the criminals and their crime spree left in their lap.
They did work out that Harry and Marv were the culprits behind all those other robberies though
I did find it funny that the rest of family showed up just after his mom does. All that work to get home quick for nothing!
it goes to show that that side plot didn't add all that much to the movie.
I'd like to think that Kevin did explain what happened to him. Dad found the gold tooth and Buzz's room was destroyed. Explain that Kevin!
I like that the ending doesn't show us everything, and that we can imagine that the family kept on living afterwards
We needed to see Gus Polinski.

uid1response.feedback: It was weird to talk about the movie with only the information given when we had clearly both seen it and remembered much more detail.
